name: New Runner Deck
Corp Tournament 2
Stirling Guard 1.0
description: force them rez all HQ & remote ICE, then sneakdoor or R&D lock

name: Neural Overload HP
description:
Step 1: Score Efficiency Committee. Quick. Use Cheap ICE and Fast Track to help achieve this goal.

Step 2: Play defensively until you have Jackson, Shutdown and Diagnostics ready, as well as no neurals in hand, and a maximum of 1 reclaimation order. And 11 credits. And the runner should have 4 or less cards in hand.

Step 3: After a run, use Efficiency Committee to gain 3 more actions. Play Jackson, play Shutdown and empty your deck, use Jackson to shuffle back 2 neurals and a reclaimation order, play diagnostics, use reclaimation order to get all 3 neurals back, and deal a total of 5 net damage in one turn.

The deck isn't very reliable, and I'll recommend it for the players who love the satisfaction of stupid combos :).

name: Connecting Andromeda
description: Deck based on connections that gives massive economy. Hostage for getting Katie Jones early or Professional Contacts for card draw with additional credit. Main job is heavy running on HQ direct or via Archives. A bit slow to set up but Early Bird scares a bit fast-scoring corporation ;)

name: No Cyberspace for Old Man
description:
Response to 'what would big rig criminal look like'. This deck is intended to prolong the game, getting the most out of Iain's ability, Underworld Contacts, and Kati. Once it gets to late game, there should be an efficient breaker suite and a pile of money to make runs however required. My big problem right now is that influence sucks with Iain! Testing to be carried out tomorrow.

First test game on OCTGN won pretty convincingly against a Harmony Medtech 6-3. From the start of the 3rd turn I was getting 1 cred per turn, and my last 3-4 turns I was gaining 4 credits per turn, so the trickle economy worked. Since I have so many resources, it's important to note that I really can't afford to take tags (unless I've got a fallguy or decoy out), but paying for Traces is a bit easier since I want to have 2 link at all times.

Dream hand would be something like Underworld, Logos, Dyson Mem Chip, Mr. Li, and any one of Sure Gamble, Hostage, Express Delivery, Kati. I don't think I have the card density to get it reliably, but more play testing will see.

Garrote is really expensive to play. Good lord.

name: jTennin
jTennin
The theory of a Chaos Overmind v1.2
description:
Overmind spam more or less. I'm still not sure if this thing would work though and since I don't think that I'll have the opportunity to test this deck anytime soon, I'm hoping that someone here will be brave and try it out!:)

As always, I'd appreciate any feedback. * I made a small change, I removed the 2 retrieval run and added 2 legwork. * This deck has a big problem with jinteki. They have a lot of relatively cheap ice with a lot of subroutines and unlike HB you can't just use clicks to brake them.

name: Bam! Headshot v2.0
description:
Well, my initial attempt to make this deck using Reina was abominable; it was trying to do too many things at once. So here is an updated version with a far simpler remit:

I am going to run HQ, and do my damnedest to wreck the place. To this end I've switched to Whizzard. My plan is to multi-access HQ, steal what I can, trash what I can't, and then either use Demolition run or Hemorrhage to chuck the rest of their hand.

I would love to put a third Djinn and Deja Vu in here, but I physically don't have them. I'm not sure if I need the second Sneakdoor. Any opinions on this would be appreciated.

I haven't played it yet, so I'll keep you updated.

name: Angry Player Express 3.1
ExA.I.le 2.0
description:
After a lot of play testing on the first build of this deck I decided to make a few changes that really helped the economy and pacing for this runner.

First of all I decided to get away from the underworld contacts which is too slow and only provides a small amount of income (plus relies on Globosec to work) with three Personal workshops. This card is amazing with the hardware in this rig as it is all pretty much free if you are willing to wait one turn, which usually is fine as all the hardware is used to support the AI. Secondly PW can make AI programs super convenient when face checking to avoid early destroyers, or Swordsman and only pull them out when needed (or just to get a free knight). If/when these ICE rear their ugly heads mimic and sharpshooter can be called up or cloned to take them out, and don't take away from free chip space needed for Overmind. As a final note PW also lets you slowly work off Overmind while allocating money towards more MU chips or LLDS chips.

I also decided to add in three LLDS processors which, for the first time that I have ever seen, really shine in this deck and save a lot of money when paired with Overmind. Test running, clone chipping, or installing Overmind off of PW gives it a lot more flexibility and LLDS boosts it enough to cover all of the lower strength ICE that this card is meant to break. Similarly LLDS is useful with Knight which really only comes out for the big strength ICE and doesn't tend to last very long anyway so knights regularly pop in and out of archive for draws and LLDS boosts.

I've been super happy with these changes and made one of my first Exile decks which I think is pretty damn strong. The pacing is really fun and I find that once things get going the steady income of Armitage lets me run once each turn with impunity. I also enjoy the theme of having Exile build his entire rig for next to nothing, which this deck does well. The econ can take a bit of juggling to fit, but once you get it this deck is really scary for a lot of corps, especially those that play a shell game.

name: The Hipster Chessmaster
Official Honnor and Profit Runner Deck
description: To be able to find this deck again in the future.

name: Prepaid Event Toolbox
description:
Ok I know what you might be thinking.... This deck looks inconsistent as $%?&!!! But it's really not.

Your main players here are Prepaid VoicePAD, Planned Assault, Quality Time and Same Old Thing. These all work together to tutor fast for cheap and recurr what you want in a blink. Levy AR Lab Access is there as your backup or once your rig is established to bring those tutors back to spam events super cheap.

I'm not a fan of Lucky Find for the influence or Satellite Uplink for Ken decks but in this case you can always discard them if they're dead draws and SoT can bring them back if need be with lowered costs.

I find Public Terminal to actually really suck compared to Prepaid VoicePAD because they're too situational based on your draw and corp players are smart enough to know they must protect from the run events Inside Job, The Maker's Eye and Account Siphon.

Programs are simple, my friends know me as "that guy who loves Faerie" when playing criminal but they are a fantastic way to facecheck without major repercussions and most of the time whenever I have a Special Order without a good program rig and cards are unrezzed I'm left wishing I had one instead to just go aggro.

name: Exposed Lies v0.2
description: I moved some influence around to give myself back a second Gordian Blade (I had a Peacock in there for a while) and took out the Lucky Finds for Armitages. I originally thought that I needed event econ to get my hand down in the first turn and play Blackguard, but that's stupid because I can play Armitage for cheap and then suck money off of it second turn and play Blackguard then, which is smarter. It's kind of a waste to put it out first turn and then not be able to do anything with it.

name: Fast Track to death V 2.0
description:
I changed some ICE and got more operations. No problem with money in my last games :-)

I like the BL + PE Combo. I won my last game with BL + BL + FT + PE

Precognition is very helpful in this deck. @PeekaySK: Thank you for this advice.

Still testing...

name: Double Down
description: Starlight Crusade Funding deck. Play your doubles, get free stuff with Eureka/Test Run, generate tons of money, run anywhere, recycle it all back in.

name: NBN – First Attempt
description: Really new to NR and Deck Building...so feedback would be nice.

name: Exposé MK IV
description: Make sure that the Corp has no secrets, no tricks or traps. Using Legwork to run HQ and get at extra cards along. Using a full Icebreaker suite, you should be able to get at everything you need. Make good use of Sillhouette's ability and you'll know where to run, and when. Plenty of Econ in there just to keep things chugging along at pace.

name: Blue Sun Exploration
description:
My first attempt at a Blue Sun deck.

Mulligan for an Oversight AI if you can, and use it to get out a Curtain Wall/Janus 1.0.

Build some impenetrable centrals and Off the Grid. 4/7ths of this deck is sentries, which is mildly concerning, but Runners often go for Sentry first (especially against Weyland/Jinteki), so they'll likely have one. This deck just makes them punishing. Early Hive can be bounced later and discarded. Use Hostile Takeover as fuel for Archer. Keep Curtain Wall on the outside with your ID ability.

Infinite Adonis Campaign is your primary economy, with Subliminal for drip (this is not a deck the Runner is going to want to hit every turn) and Hedge Fund for burst. Infinite Elizabeth Mills resolves the Bad Pub from your Hostile Takeovers and Swarms. Priority Requisition also works great with Blue Sun.

I did not include the following cards that are often classics in Weyland/Corp decks:

  • Action Jackson: No influence, and I think Blue Sun sings with Janus and Adonis.
  • Scorched Earth: Feels weird to make a Weyland deck without Scorched, but this deck feels like it exists as the biggest, meanest glacial I can think of. Flatlining isn't its goal; this deck feels more like Redcoats.
  • Chimera: A classic, and may get added back in for early game, but getting derezzed removes the entire perk of Blue Sun, and this deck is already 21 ICE, 2/7ths of which the Corp doesn't want to bounce (advanced Swarm and Archer).

name: Pay Now, Dont Pay Later
description:
Event heavy Iain Stirling deck. The Idea been while your setting up your rig you get free credits from the corp scores, Then you pile the pressure on with events when set up with runs all over the place.

The Prepaid VoicePAD helps the econ immensely.

New Angeles lets you avoid tags all day long and completely ignore them data-ravens, the 2 fall guys help keep them up and running.

data-dealer is a shi kyu counter plus can be used to drop you back a few points if need be.

Torch, Garrote & Corroded for excellent efficiency once you get them out theirs no stopping you.

Desperado helps keep the econ going when your running.

Plascrete Carapace is the only thing i am unsure of in this deck its in mainly as a back up in case things go wrong but you shouldn't really be taking tags so meat damage is unlikely.

name: Runner Tourn 2
Pick Up That Can!
description: Now with more Hokusai Grid! Thanks to @db0 for the inspiration.

name: NBN Tag & Bag
description: Aggressive Negotiation works great with Breaking News, and can help land an easy SE kill. Mixed sentries keep the runner on their toes. Lots of economy, because corps should be rich. Using 1xCoreSet, Trace Amount, Second Thoughts & Mala Tempora.

name: Wholesale Andy
description:
I'm playing around with this gimmicky deck and I wanted to share it. I don't even have H&P yet so take this with a grain of salt.

As you might guess the idea is to Mass Install a Killer, a Decoder, and a Fracter using Mass Install during the first turn, taking full advantage of the starting hand, and then proceed to Siphon the corp.

That's, of course, the ideal situation. More often you'll just install whatever is in your hand, or sell all the programs with FCC if you dislike it, using Quality Time to draw more as needed.

MO is for end game, probably, in case you are running low on cash. As I said I haven't tried this deck yet, but I think I'm safer with MO in the deck than without it.

Edit: If you're bored click the Card draw simulator and try to Mass Install your own suite!
